snippet: Executives sent a series of emails to California health officials asking them to emphasize that the theme park was not responsible for an outbreak and was safe to visit.
abstract: Documents show that Disneyland executives contacted California health officials in January during measles outbreak; email records indicate that, while working with public health officials to alert public to danger of situation, Disney executives also asked for help in clarifying park was not responsible for the illnesses and that vaccinated people could safely visit.
lead_paragraph: Executives sent a series of emails to California health officials asking them to emphasize that the theme park was not responsible for an outbreak and was safe to visit.

headline.main: In Emails, Disney Worried About Measles Depiction
headline.print_headline: In Emails, Disney Worried About Measles Depiction

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
